Award.AwardTitle: Center for Aviation and Automotive Technological Education Using Virtual E-School [CA2VES]: A Resource to Meet Technician Workforce Needs

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Education and Human Resources

Award.AbstractNarration:
South Carolina (SC) is rapidly expanding into aviation, automotive, and advanced manufacturing, and regional employers are increasingly in need of well-educated technicians who are familiar with the specialized demands of a new generation of manufacturing jobs. The Center for Aviation and Automotive Technological Education Using Virtual E-Schools (CA2VES) and the state's 2-year institutions are creating opportunities to improve technician and STEM education and increase workforce preparedness for a large and diverse population of SC students. CA2VES brings together global and regional industry and educational partners to develop and disseminate such Digital Learning Tools (DLTs) as digital curricula, e-learning, simulations and virtual reality (VR) modules. DLTs have already given students greater academic control over time, place, path and pace, and provided students with the skills required by the rapidly expanding automotive and aerospace industries in the region.

The CA2VES team will continue to lead the design and development of DLTs working with industries and employers, and collaborate with Co-PIs (Florence-Darlington Technical College, Greenville Technical College, Spartanburg Community College and the SCATE Center) and additional ATE Centers to evaluate the effectiveness of DLTs in technician education programs. CA2VES and partners will design and execute recruitment campaigns to attract and engage underserved populations (specifically women, minorities and students from rural areas). CA2VES will also partner with 2-year institutions and high schools to customize and modularize DLTs, field test new modules and conduct ongoing research evaluating how others replicate and use CA2VES DLTs. The team will assess the improved pedagogical effectiveness of its work in the areas of innovations in teaching and learning, technology integration and workforce development. Additionally, the Center will provide rigorous evidence-based research in VR development for technician education and become a sustainable resource.

ProgramReference.Text: EXP PROG TO STIM COMP RES
REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Center for Aviation and Automotive Technology Education using Virtual E-Schools (CA?VES), located at Clemson University in South Carolina, serves as a state, regional, and national resource for e-learning and digital learning tools research. CA?VES also engages in professional development and creation of advanced curriculum to help educate and prepare a sustainable, multi-skilled technician workforce for various manufacturing industries, including automotive, aviation, and advanced manufacturing across industry sectors in the United States. CA?VES identifies and meets the needs of technician education faculty and students with innovative research, digital learning tools, and curriculum applications.

CA?VES created the following digital learning tools and curriculum applications:

  • 24 courses
  • 138 modules within the courses
  • 527 lessons within the modules
  • 581 video lectures
  • 33 VR simulations
  • 1693 activities
  • 3587 assessments
  • 8 ebooks
  • 1 ePub
  • 14 digital lesson plans

To support widespread dissemination of the developed content listed above, the CA2VES project team built EducateWorkforce.com (https://educateworkforce.com), an online learning portal offered to partnering agencies to help them integrate web and digital learning solutions into their existing courses and/or training programs. The platform was created to incorporate instructional design, usability, and research-based learning features. The platform represents a new approach to learning, seamlessly integrating Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles for curriculum development, allowing all individuals equal opportunity to learn.  CA?VES partners include public school systems, 2-year colleges, 4-year colleges, industry, other ATE Centers, government agencies and non-profit organizations.
